Hi,

we are using munin [1], to plot e.g. no docs, MB/s etc.

Integrating with munin is simple you can use any scripting language to
produce the value you want to monitor.
As example a script that reads the MB/s from the progress log of the
last job.

I attach a sample output, below the script.

HTH
  Holger

#!/bin/sh
#Bandwidth in MB/s from progress-statistics.log

case $1 in
   config)
        cat <<'EOM'
graph_title heritrix MB per seconds
graph_vlabel megabytespersecond
megabytespersecond.label megabytespersecond
EOM
        exit 0;;
esac

THEPATH=/usr/local/tarantula/jobs/
THEPATH=${THEPATH}`ls -la ${THEPATH} | egrep -Eo "active.+" | tail -n 1`
echo -n "megabytespersecond.value "
tail -n 1 $THEPATH/logs/progress-statistics.log | awk '{print $6}' | cut
-d '(' -f1


[1]http://munin.projects.linpro.no/
